alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Columbus; Inland Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 5:46PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Brunswick, Columbus, central Florence, northeastern Georgetown, Horry, Marion and northeastern Williamsburg Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hallsboro to Homewood to Effingham. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Florence, Myrtle Beach, Conway, North Myrtle Beach, Marion, Oak Island, Whiteville, DeBordieu Colony, Mullins, Surfside Beach, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Pawleys Island, Murrells Inlet, Little River Entrance, Ocean Crest Pier, Springmaid Pier, and Garden City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 near mile marker 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 160 and 164. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 24. SC Highway 31 between mile markers 5 and 24. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 1 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
